title: Sources: 49ers' Collins third Round 2 pick in fold

content: West Bengal goes to the polls next year, while the Assembly election is due in Bihar later this year.

content: The IT Minister felicitated CSC operators in remote and rural districts, and said the government would train CSC workers in AI and address issues arising from duplication of CSC work by State government initiatives.

content: The wellness initiative has been taken up by Lok Sabha Speak Om Birla; the dishes on offer are millet-based meals, fibre-rich salads and protein-packed soups as part of a broader effort to support a healthy diet

title: Himachal Pradesh to get additional â‚¹150 crore revenue after royalty hike in hydroelectric project
content: A State government statement said the JSW energy company will have to pay 18% royalty to the State instead of 12% from the Karcham-Wangtoo hydroelectric project

title: Woman Dies After Giving Birth At Bihar Hospital, Family Alleges Negligence
content: A woman died in a private hospital in Bihar's Siwan after giving birth to twins. The family has claimed that the woman passed away due to alleged negligence by the hospital authorities and said that the doctors ran away.

title: 40 Fractures, Blunt Trauma: Indore Man Assaulted Over Theft Suspicion
content: Umendra Singh Thakur, 28, died after being allegedly brutally beaten by a group of labourers and guards associated with a bridge construction company. The attackers accused him of stealing iron rods - a suspicion that turned into a fatal assault.

title: President Murmu To Present Swachh Survekshan Cleanliness Awards Today
content: President Droupadi Murmu will confer the prestigious Swachh Survekshan 2024-25 Awards for urban cleanliness during a national ceremony organised by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi, on Thursday.

title: 3.3 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Haryana's Rohtak, 4th Tremor In 8 Days
content: An earthquake measuring 3.3 on the Richter scale struck Rohtak in Haryana early Thursday, according to the National Centre for Seismology (NCS).

title: 85 Rescued By Visakhapatnam Cops After Crackdown On Human Trafficking Racket
content: Visakhapatnam Police has rescued 85 individuals and arrested 22 in a major crackdown on human trafficking and cybercrime operations, Dr. Shankabrata Bagchi, Visakhapatnam Police Commissioner announced on Wednesday.

title: In US Trade Deal Race, India Seeks Lower Tariff Than Indonesia: Report
content: Indian officials are hoping to secure a trade deal with US President Donald Trump at a lower tariff rate than he'd agreed with Indonesia as New Delhi races to meet an August 1 deadline.

title: Interfaith Couple Dies By Suicide In Hyderabad Four Months After Marriage
content: Asia Hashim Khan, 29, from Uttar Pradesh and Pavan Kumavath, 21, from Rajasthan, who got married four months ago, were found dead in their rented house in Laxmi Nagar, Golnaka.

title: Karnataka Blames RCB For Bengaluru Stampede, Report Mentions Virat Kohli
content: "RCB invited public without consulting police": Karnataka government's status report on Bengaluru stampede

title: "Atmosphere Of Fear": Chandra Shekhar Aazad To NDTV On Kanwar Yatra "Violence"
content: Chandra Shekhar Aazad was referring to recent incidents of Kanwariyas allegedly damaging cars after they brushed past them.

title: Supplementary Chargesheet Filed Against Manipur Firm For Cheating 5,000 Investors
content: Birla Emporium and Ira Finance operated unauthorized investment schemes and offered "Loan Against Property" deals, the Enforcement Directorate said.

title: 12-Year-Old Detained For Sending Bomb Threat E-mail To Dwarka School
content: A 12-year-old student was detained for sending a bomb threat to St Thomas School in Dwarka on July 15. The school received another bomb threat in less than 24 hours on Wednesday, they said.

title: US Embassy's Visa Warning After Indian Caught Stealing From Target Store
content: An Indian woman allegedly spent over seven hours in a Target store, picking up items worth Rs 1.1 lakh and then tried to leave the store without paying.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Anguish Of Nimisha Priya And The Imperative Of Compassion
content: Nimisha's story is, sadly, one that epitomises the hopes and vulnerabilities of many Keralites who seek opportunity in distant lands.

title: Odisha Bandh Today, Roads Empty In Protest Over Student's Self-Immolation
content: The 20-year-old student of Fakir Mohan Autonomous College in Balasore attempted self-immolation last week after allegedly facing prolonged sexual harassment by her college's Head of Department.

title: Assets Worth Rs 9.56 Crore Returned To Official Liquidator In Bank Fraud Case
content: In a major breakthrough in its anti-money laundering efforts, the Enforcement Directorate, Kolkata Zonal Office, has successfully restituted immovable and movable properties worth Rs 9.56 crore to the Official Liquidator of Kaushik Glob

title: KTR Sidelines Sister Kavitha For Key Appointment Amid Reports Of Rift
content: The Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) working president KT Rama Rao has appointed former minister Koppula Eashwar as the party's in-charge for the Telangana Boggu Gani Karmika Sangham (TBGKS), the influential coal miners' union.

title: 4 Dead As Bangladeshi Forces Clash With Sheikh Hasina Supporters
content: Bangladeshi security forces on Wednesday clashed with supporters of ousted Sheikh Hasina, leaving at least four people dead and scores injured, a hospital official and local media said.

title: Syria, Druze Leaders Announce New Ceasefire As Israel Continues Strikes
content: Convoys of government forces began withdrawing from the city of Sweida, but it was not immediately clear if the agreement, announced by Syria's Interior Ministry and in a video message by a Druze religious leader, would hold.

title: Syria Says Withdrawing Troops After Agreeing To Ceasefire In Sweida
content: Syria announced it had begun withdrawing its army from Druze-majority Sweida city on Wednesday night after agreeing to a new ceasefire that it said would bring a complete halt to its military operations there.

title: Compelling dead marriage to go on perpetuates mental agony: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court of India has ruled that courts can grant divorce when a marriage is irretrievably broken, ending a 16-year matrimonial dispute. Justices Nath and Mehta invoked Article 142, emphasizing that forcing couples to stay in 'dead marriages' causes mental agony.

title: 'Assigning blame before ...' : Pilots' body raises red flag over Air India 171 crash report
content: The Federation of Indian Pilots (FIP) has voiced strong concerns regarding the preliminary report on the Air India Flight AI171 crash in Ahmedabad, which killed 240 people. FIP criticized the exclusion of pilot representatives from the investigation and the report's reliance on selectively interpreted cockpit recordings.

title: Language row: Shopkeeper assaulted over â€˜anti-Marathiâ€™ WhatsApp status
content: In Mumbai's Vikhroli, a shopkeeper faced assault by MNS members over an allegedly 'anti-Marathi' WhatsApp status. Confronted outside his shop, he was physically attacked and forced to publicly apologize. A video shows him holding his ears and begging for forgiveness, while MNS workers warned against disrespecting Marathi culture. Police are yet to confirm if a complaint has been filed.

title: 'Sniper unit fired upon convoy': 27 Pak troops killed in attacks by Baloch fighters
content: Baloch insurgent groups have claimed responsibility for multiple deadly attacks on Pakistani military forces in Balochistan over the past two days. The Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA) stated its Fateh Squad targeted a military transport bus in Kalat, reportedly killing 27 troops. The Balochistan Liberation Front (BLF) also announced separate operations, including IED blasts and ambushes, resulting in further casualties.

title: Walmart layoffs: America's largest retailer is cutting jobs; here's what memo says
content: Walmart is implementing a new round of layoffs, impacting hundreds of employees in store support and training as part of restructuring efforts. The company is removing market coordinator positions and coach roles at Walmart Academy to simplify operations and reduce friction for store associates.

title: Indian woman caught shoplifting: US embassy reacts after viral video; issues warning
content: Following the arrest of an Indian tourist in the US for alleged shoplifting, the US Embassy in India issued a stern warning. Visa holders risk revocation and a permanent ban for breaking American laws, including theft and assault. Immigration lawyer Alen Takhsh highlighted the severe consequences, even without a conviction, potentially leading to deportation.

title: 9-year-old girl dies of suspected heart attack; fainted while having lunch at school
content: In a tragic incident, nine-year-old Prachi Kumawat, a Class 4 student in Sikar district, passed away at school due to a suspected heart attack. During lunch break, she collapsed while opening her tiffin box. Despite immediate medical attention and CPR at a local hospital, she was referred to a larger hospital in Sikar, but was declared dead on arrival.

title: TCS variable pay: 70% employees get 100%; payment to the rest will be based on...
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) will provide 100% variable pay to approximately 70% of its employees up to the C2 grade for the June quarter. Variable pay for employees in the C3 grade and above will be determined by the performance of their respective business units.

title: Prisoner on parole attacked at Patna hospital by rival gang during treatment
content: A parolee, Chandan Mishra, facing murder charges, was attacked by a rival gang at a Patna hospital while receiving treatment. Patna police are collaborating with Buxar police to identify the shooters, possessing their photographs. This incident adds to a series of shootings in Bihar, intensifying criticism of the state government's law and order management ahead of upcoming elections.

title: Gold smuggling case twist: No bail to Ranya Rao for 1 year
content: Kannada actress Ranya Rao faces a year in jail for gold smuggling, following an order from the COFEPOSA Advisory Board, which also denied her bail. Arrested at Bengaluru airport with 14.8 kg of gold worth Rs 12.56 crore smuggled from Dubai, Ranya's earlier bail pleas were rejected.

title: 10-year-old girl returning home from school sexually assaulted in Tamil Nadu
content: A shocking incident occurred near Gummidipoondi. A 10-year-old girl was abducted and sexually assaulted. The girl was returning home from school. An unidentified man committed this heinous crime. The girl bravely raised an alarm. This forced the perpetrator to flee. Police have registered a case under the Pocso Act. Special teams are searching for the suspect.

title: Anand Mahindra's message to Elon Musk on Tesla India launch: Meet you at ...
content: Anand Mahindra welcomed Elon Musk and Tesla to India as the EV company officially debuted with its first showroom, the Tesla Experience Centre, in Mumbai. Mahindra expressed optimism and acknowledged the competition Tesla brings to India's growing EV sector. Tesla has launched its Model Y in India, with prices starting at Rs 61 lakh.

title: Gold & silver prediction: Yellow metal might hit Rs 1 lakh soon - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to rise, potentially reaching â‚¹99,800, driven by technical indicators and favorable fundamentals like easing Fed rate pressure. Silver has seen a rally, supported by industrial demand and macroeconomic uncertainties.

title: 'Not afraid of war': Syria slams Israel's 'wide-scale targeting' of civilians - Key details
content: Syria's interim President Ahmed al-Sharaa pledged accountability for those who harmed the Druze population, following Israeli airstrikes in Damascus targeting military and government sites. He reassured Druze citizens, rejecting external interference and transferring security responsibilities to local leaders. Al-Sharaa affirmed the Syrian people's readiness to defend their dignity, prioritizing national interests over conflict.

title: R. Madhavan's weight loss: Simple lifestyle changes for effective results
content: R. Madhavan, known for his versatile acting, surprised fans with his weight loss journey in 2024. He revealed losing weight in just 21 days by adopting a simple, consistent lifestyle. This included intermittent fasting, chewing food thoroughly, early morning walks, screen detox before sleep, and a diet rich in green vegetables and easily metabolizable foods, while avoiding processed items.

title: 2025 ESPY Awards: 5 Best-dressed stars who dominated the red carpet
content: The 2025 ESPY Awards in Los Angeles saw athletes shine both in accomplishment and style. Suni Lee's gold gown set the tone, while Lindsey Vonn and Ilona Maher impressed with daring looks. Simone Biles and Jonathan Owens coordinated in stunning fashion, and Jordan Chiles brought elegance in a woven gown.

title: Travel diary: Manchester's 'other' Old Trafford getting ready for fourth India vs England Test
content: In Manchester, navigating to Old Trafford reveals a charming mix-up between the cricket and football stadiums. Locals, signage, and even security guards often point to the football ground first. But with the India-England Test set to take place on July 23, attention will soon shift to the "other" Old Trafford as preparations ramp up for its biggest game of the season.

title: Chinese restaurant under fire for offering lion cub cuddles
content: A Chinese restaurant is facing severe criticism for offering customers the chance to cuddle lion cubs during afternoon tea. Animal welfare groups are condemning the practice as exploitative and potentially dangerous, highlighting ethical concerns and the risk of injury. Despite the backlash, the restaurant defends its actions, claiming the cubs are well-cared for.

title: Delhi cops say 12-year-old behind bomb hoax
content: Delhi schools faced a third consecutive day of bomb threats via email, causing widespread panic and evacuations. Authorities traced Tuesday's threats to a 12-year-old student who confessed to sending them as a prank. Despite thorough searches revealing no explosives, multiple schools, including St. Thomas and Vasant Valley, received alarming emails.

title: Trade war: Trump plans 10â€“15% tariffs for over 150 countries; deal with India 'very close'
content: Donald Trump announced that the U.S. is nearing a trade agreement with India and seeing positive progress with the EU, while a deal with Canada remains uncertain. He also floated the idea of imposing tariffs on smaller nations. These discussions occur as the U.S. seeks improved trade terms before an August 1 deadline for tariff increases on most U.S. imports.

title: Snake rescuer dies after flaunting cobra on neck for 'reel'
content: Deepak Mahawar, a 42-year-old snake rescuer in Madhya Pradesh, tragically died after a cobra he rescued bit him. He had been posing with the snake around his neck for a social media video near his son's school. Although initially treated and showing signs of recovery, his condition worsened, leading to his death within 12 hours of the bite.

title: Astronomers capture birth of planets around a baby sun
content: Astronomers have spotted the earliest stages of rocky planet formation around a young, sun-like star named HOPS-315. Using the Webb Space Telescope and ESO's Alma telescope, scientists detected solid specks condensing within the gas disk, revealing silicon monoxide gas and crystalline silicate minerals. This unprecedented glimpse into "time zero" suggests planet formation could be a common process.

title: Quintuple bypass: Explaining the surgery Taylor Swiftâ€™s father underwent
content: Scott Swift, Taylor Swift's father, is recovering well after undergoing a quintuple bypass surgery last month due to a routine check-up revealing a serious heart condition. The surgery addressed coronary artery disease, a common issue caused by plaque buildup restricting blood flow. His family has been supporting him throughout his recovery.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens on a flat note; BSE Sensex near 82,600
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, started Thursdayâ€™s trading session on a flat note. While Nifty50 was near 25,200, BSE Sensex was around 82,600.

title: 'Won't keep a rupee': Co-star on Radhika Yadav music video; denies â€˜fame chaseâ€™ claims
content: Inam-ul-Haq, Radhika Yadav's co-star in 'Karwaan', pledges to donate all earnings from the music video. This decision follows the tragic death of Radhika, who was allegedly killed by her father. Inam denies any personal relationship with Radhika. He also rejects any communal angle to the incident. He is ready to cooperate with the police investigation.

title: Ahead of Bihar polls Nitish announces key scheme: Free electricity upto 125 units
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has announced free electricity for domestic consumers, up to 125 units, starting August 1, 2025. Kumar highlighted his government's focus on affordability, stating that this initiative will benefit approximately 1 crore 67 lakh families across the state. This announcement comes as the state gears up for elections in late 2025.

title: Explained: Federal Prosecutor Comey fired - was it for 'botching' Epstein-Maxwell & Diddy cases?
content: Maurene Comey, known for her involvement in the Ghislaine Maxwell and Sean "Diddy" Combs cases, was fired by the Trump administration, raising concerns about political interference. The dismissal follows other departures at SDNY and renewed scrutiny of Epstein files. Critics suggest her family connection to James Comey and the Combs trial outcome contributed to her removal, potentially impacting prosecutorial independence.

title: Narco nexus: Indo-Canadian drug lord held in US; ISI-China-Khalistan links found
content: The US Drug Enforcement Agency dismantled an international drug cartel with ties to the ISI, China, and Canada, arresting Opinder Singh Sian, also known as Thanos. Sian operated a global fentanyl and methamphetamine trafficking ring from British Columbia.

title: Shaquille Oâ€™Neal threatens to punch Robert Griffin III over Angel Reese
content: NBA legend Shaquille O'Neal has issued a stern warning to former NFL quarterback Robert Griffin III over his negative comments and a racist social media post targeting WNBA player Angel Reese. O'Neal, angered by Griffin's actions, particularly the reposting of a derogatory image, threatened physical violence if Griffin continues his behavior.

title: Actress Ranya Rao gets 1-year jail term: No bail allowed under COFEPOSA
content: Kannada actress Ranya Rao, embroiled in a gold smuggling case, faces a year of imprisonment under COFEPOSA after being arrested at Bengaluru airport with 14.8 kg of gold. Despite initially receiving default bail due to DRI procedural lapses, she remains detained. Investigations revealed multiple Dubai trips and significant seizures of gold and cash from her residence, leading to charges under the Customs Act.

title: Top stocks to buy or sell: Stock recommendations for today; check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Aakash K Hindocha from Nuvama Professional Clients Group suggests Hero Motocorp and Tata Power as top buys, citing bullish patterns and breakouts. He recommends selling Solar Industries India, anticipating profit-taking after a significant rally, targeting a correction to the 13700-800 range.

title: UP: 14-year-old girl dies by suicide days after being raped by three minors
content: A 14-year-old girl in Bulandshahr's Khurja area tragically died by suicide after being gang-raped by three minors. The assault occurred on June 28, leading to an FIR being filed under relevant laws. Overwhelmed by trauma and mental stress following the incident, the girl was found dead at her home, prompting a police investigation.

title: Massive quake: 7.3 tremor strikes off Alaska coast; tsunami warning issued
content: A significant 7.3 magnitude earthquake struck the coast of Alaska on Wednesday, triggering a tsunami warning across a large portion of the Alaska Peninsula and extending towards Anchorage. The earthquake, centered off Sand Point on Popof Island, prompted the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to issue the warning due to the potential for serious damage.

title: â€˜My daughter was born here, sheâ€™s Indianâ€™: Russian womanâ€™s ex adds to cave family saga
content: Following Nina Kutina's arrest for living in a cave near Gokarna with their two daughters, her ex-husband, Dror Goldstein, is seeking shared custody. Goldstein, who lives part-time in Goa, states he lost contact with Kutina and the children months ago. He expresses concern about their potential relocation to Russia and desires regular access to his daughters in India.

title: Watch: Massive fire engulfs Tomorrowland main stage in Belgium
content: A devastating fire has severely damaged the main stage of the Tomorrowland festival in Belgium, just days before its scheduled opening. While no injuries were reported among the 1,000 staff members present, the iconic stage is almost completely destroyed. Despite the setback, organizers have confirmed that the festival will proceed, with DreamVille opening as planned.

title: Kerala woman, toddler found hanging in UAE; suicide note posted on Facebook
content: Kundara Police filed cases against Nitheesh, Neethu, and Mohanan. They are accused of abetting the suicide of Vipanchika and her daughter in Sharjah. Vipanchika's family alleges dowry harassment and abuse. A suicide note detailing the torture surfaced online. The family demands repatriation of the bodies and a thorough postmortem.

title: 2 Instagram influencers held in UP for vulgar content
content: In Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal district, police have arrested four individualsâ€”Mehak, Pari, Hina, and Jarrar Alamâ€”for allegedly creating and posting obscene content on Instagram. The group reportedly used vulgar language and explicit visuals to attract viewers and generate income, earning approximately Rs 25,000 to Rs 30,000 monthly.

title: Rahul, Kharge write to PM Modi for J&K statehood; CM Omar Abdullah welcomes move
content: Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge have urged Prime Minister Modi to restore statehood to Jammu & Kashmir via a parliamentary bill during the monsoon session. They also advocated for Sixth Schedule constitutional safeguards for Ladakh, addressing cultural, developmental, and political needs while protecting rights and identity.

title: Bengali-speaker raids: Calcutta HC steps in; demands Centreâ€™s clarification
content: Calcutta High Court has directed the Union government to clarify the rationale behind the nationwide raids targeting Bengali-speaking individuals, suspecting them as illegal Bangladeshi migrants. The court raised concerns about potential wrongful acts and illegal deportations based solely on language.

title: 'Would call her Ma': Shubhangi Atre recalls how Rupali Ganguly cared for her daughter
content: Shubhangi Atre, known for her role in Bhabiji Ghar Par Hain, recently shared her early experiences in the television industry, highlighting the challenges of being a working mother. She fondly remembers her Kasturi co-star, Rupali Ganguly, who played a significant role in caring for her daughter, Ashi, on set.

title: Canâ€™t win today's warfare with yesterdayâ€™s weapons, desi drone tech must: CDS Chauhan
content: General Anil Chauhan emphasized the critical need for India to develop indigenous drone and counter-UAS technologies to maintain a strategic advantage. He highlighted Operation Sindoor, where Pakistan's drones caused no damage, underscoring the limitations of relying on foreign systems.

title: Balasore girl killed self after being forced to apologise to harasser, drop plaint - Kin
content: A college student in Odisha died after allegedly being coerced by her principal to withdraw a sexual harassment complaint. Prior to setting herself ablaze, she was allegedly pressured to apologize to the accused faculty member. The incident sparked public outrage, leading to protests and political clashes.

title: Aadhaar cleanup: UIDAI disables 1.2 crore dead IDs; 100+ age cases under scan
content: To prevent misuse, the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has deactivated approximately 1.2 crore Aadhaar numbers of deceased individuals, utilizing death records from 24 states and Union Territories. A new service on the myAadhaar portal allows family members to report a death.

title: Talks on with RJD & Left, but Congress may settle for 50-60 seats in Bihar
content: Congress is likely to contest fewer seats in Bihar than in 2020, aiming for 50-60 seats while prioritizing winnability after a disappointing performance last time. The party seeks alliance coherence and aims to strengthen the anti-NDA coalition by promoting Rahul Gandhi's message among backward classes. This strategic shift reflects lessons learned from past failures and a focus on unity.

content: Embiid was a media darling, both wry fabulist and helpless confessor . he spent two years rehabbing from surgeries to his right foot in the summers of 2014 and 2015 . his son, Arthur, is upstairs preparing for her birthday celebration .

title: The Suns turned a superteam into a costly cautionary tale
content: if the latest era of Phoenix Suns basketball mostly ended last month, it reached its full conclusion . the franchise bought out the remainder of Bradley Beal 's contract, just two seasons after acquiring him . he quickly engineered blockbuster trades for Durant and Beal, who had a combined 16 All-Star appearances .
